TEXT.citation: Indigenous Languages Research and Development Foundation. (2020). 族語E樂園. https://web.klokah.tw/

S.FORM: Na’ayho mapolong. satapangto kita.
Katomireng. Mita’ong.
Nga’ayho singsi.
Kamaro’.
Nga’ayho mapolong. anini a romi’ad o pakayniay ino kaka^nen ko sapaka fana’ no singsi.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的阿美語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to speak Ami for food.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso a mitengil to sowal no singsi haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: Singsi, cowa kafana’ kako a mitengil to sowal iso. liyawenho kora sowal.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: Cowa ka tengil ako, nga’ay ta’angayen ko ngiha’haw?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: Pasaynien ko pinengnegen. todongen kopi ‘osi ako.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: Nga’ayay kopi ’osi iso.
Liyawen a mi’osi. Ta’angayen ko ngiha’.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: Katomerep. aka caciyaw.
Sadaken ko tilid.
Hay, singsi
Sadaken ko impic.
Singsi, matawalay ako a miala ko impic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: Sadaken ko sasipasip.
Singsi, matawalay ako a miala ko sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: Caliwen kono tatihiay a sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: Nga’ay pacaliwen kako to sasipasip?
Pahanhanto kita.
Hatini ko pinanam ita anini. Liyawto a lipay masaso’araw kita.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: Cima kiso?
Ci kacaw kako.
Cima kiso?
O wawa ni Mayaw kako. ci kacaw kako.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Mayaw, and my name is Kacaw.

S.FORM: Cima kiso?
Ci Kacaw kako, o mitiliday ni Mayaw kako.
Samaanay ko ngangan iso?
O ngangan ako ci Kacaw.
Cima ko ngangan ni Ama iso?
Ci mayaw ko ngangan ni Ama ako.
Cima cingra?
ci Kolas cingra.
O kaka ako cingra, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
S.TRANSL: He’s my brother, his name is Kolas.

S.FORM: cima ko ngaangan ningra?
Ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?.
Hay, ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Mayaw ko ngangan ningra haw?
Caay, ci Kolas ko ngangan ningra.
Cima kara tamdaw?
Ci panay cingra. o fai ako.
Cima kora tamdaw?
O idang ako cingra, ci Imoy ko ngangan ningra.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Imoy。
She’s my friend, her name is Imoy.

S.FORM: Pina ko mihecaan iso anini a mihecaan?
Mo^tep ko mihecaan a ko anini.
Pina ko mihecaan ningra anini?
Tosa ko safaw ko mihecaan niira anini.
Pina ko mihecaan ni wama iso anini mihecaan?
Limapolo’ ko mihecaan ni wama ako anini.
Papina ko salikaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Tatosa ko kaka ako, cecay ko safa ako to fa’inayan.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: Iraay ko fa’inayan a kaka iso haw?
Away ko fa’inayan a kaka ako.
Papina ko paro no loma’ namo?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: Sasepat ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: I cowaay kiso a mitilid?
I kalinkoay kako a mitilid.
Cima cingra?
O faki ako cingra.
O maan ko tayal ni faki iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: O tayrin cingra.
Cima kora tamdaw?
O fafahiyan a kaka ako cingra.
Iraay ko katayalan ni kaka iso haw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: Itiraay i paisingan a matayal cingra.
O malikakaay cangra a tatosa haw?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: Caay, o malawidangay cangra.
O incoming kiso haw?
O pangcah kiso haw?
Hay, o ’Amis kako.
O incoming ko ramod iso haw?
O pangcah ko ramod iso haw?
Hay, nikawrira o piwma a fanacadan cingra.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but she’s from the Puyuma tribe.

S.FORM: Akawangay ci wama iso haw?
Hay, mahemekay ko paro no loma’ niyam a ma^min.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: Mitilidayto ko fafahiyan a safa isohaw?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: Hay, mitilidayto.
Mafana’ay ko safa iso a somowal tono ’Amis haw?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: Hay, mafana’ay cangra a somowal.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: Papina ko salikaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: Tatoloay ko salikaka ako.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: Malacecayay kiso to ina ato wama iso a maro’haw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: Hay, malacecayay kako to ina ato wama ako a maro’.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: Malacecayay kiso to Akong ato ama: iso a maro’haw?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: cowa, cowa ka lacecay kami a maro’.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: Cima ko cafay iso a maro’?
Ci wama ako ato ina ako, o kaka ako to fa’inayan Ko cafay ako a maro.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: Nani cowaay kiso?
Nani etolan nanay kako.
I cowaay ko loma’ namo?
I etolan ko loma’ niyam.
I cowaay ko niyaro’ iso?
I etolon ko niyaro ako.
I cowaay ko niyaro namo?
I posongay ko niyaro’ niyam.
Ano hacowa kiso a minokay I niyaro’?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Ano pahanhannan tono kacidalan a minokay kako.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: O wawa no Pangcah kako.
Masamaan ko romi’ad anini?
Masadakay to ko cidal, faedetay ko romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: Sienaway i papotal haw?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: Sienaway, adihayen ko mica’dongan a riko’.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Faedetay i papotal haw?
Cowa, mafaliay, saemelay.
Masa maanay ko romi’ad anini?
Anini a romi’ad cowa ka sienaw cowa ka faedet sanga’ayay sanay.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: Masamaanay tona dadaya?
Away ko to’em i kakarayan, masadakay to ko fo’is.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: Samaanay i papotal?
Katomerepho no ’orad, macidalayto, iraay ko talakal i Idek.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad itira?
Ta’angayay ko fali i tamiyanan.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: Nga’ayay ko romi’ad i tira haw?
Nga’ayay, ta’angayay ko cidal.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: Tayrato kako i pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: Sienaway ko romi’ad, adihayen ko riko’.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: Malingad to kako.
Ta’angay ko ’orad ano sawni. alaen ko linay.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Ma’orad saw?
Makakelengay i sawni, mama’orad ano sawni.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday to haw?
Ma’oraday i sawni, tomerepayto nohatiai.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: Ma’oradayto haw?
Hato nama ’oraday to, macepa’ay ko lalan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: Ma’oraday haw? Mana cepa’saan ko tireng iso.
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: Ma’oraday ko papotal, cowa ka cilinay kako.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: Nga’ayayho kiso haw?
Ta’angayay ko fali, adadaay ko fongoh ako tona maiyof no fali.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: Nga’ayay kiso haw?
Ta’angayay ko cidal, lasang sanay ko fongoh ako tona mapacidal.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: Matawalay ako miala to impic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: Pacaliwen ako kiso.
Matawalay ako miala ko ’alapit.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: Mahaenay kako matawalay ako, tata mi’aca kita.
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kita to impic haw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: Hayda, mi’aca kita to sasipasip.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kita to sakaranam haw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: Aka to, maherek to komaen i loma’ kako.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: Matawalay ako a mifa^det to patafoan.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Alaen fa^deten kalikien.
Matawalay ako a miala ko patafoan.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: Lacafay sa kita komaen to tafoan ako.
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: O maan ko sakalahok iso?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: O sakalahok no pitilidan ko kakaenen ako.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: O maan ko saka lahok iso ano kalahokan?
S.TRANSL: What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: Mialaay kako to patafoan anini aromi’ad, malacafay Kita a malahok.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: Mimali kita to lankiw haw?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: Hayda, tata mimali kita.
Tata misalama kita to yakiw haw?
Aka, mi’osi kako to tilid.
Patadoen kako a miala to saasik.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: Hayda, pafelien ako kiso tona saasik.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: Patadoen kako a miala to kamid haw?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: Miasikay kako, cikacaw ko papi alaen.
S.TRANSL: I'm sweeping the floor, you ask Kacaw to help you.

S.FORM: Maharekay to kiso a miasik haw?
Maharekayto ako a miasik.
Mana caka piasiken iso?
Maharekay to ako a miasik.
Makaditay ko paenan, sifinen ho.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Hayi, mialakako to sasisit.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: Makaditay kora sasingaran. sifinen ho.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: Akaho, caho kaharek ako a miasik itini.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: Mimaan kiso ano honi?
Mikilim kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: Ano minokay kiso namitilid mimaan kiso?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: Miraradiw kako ato widang ako.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: Ano minokay ciira namitilid mimaanto ciira?
Midangoy ciira.
Iraay ci Lisin i loma’haw?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Lisin is home?

S.FORM: Iraay cingra i loma’, picomod.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: Iraay ci Lisin i loma’ haw?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Lisin is home?

S.FORM: Away ciira i loma’, mimaan kiso?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: Cima saw?
A kong, ci panay kako.
Cima saw?
Kacaw, cimayaw kako, tayniay kako a misalama.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw, I’m Mayaw, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: Halafinto a caka saso araw kita.
Hayi, ma’ilolay kako ’ tisowanan, katayni misacaciyaw kita.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: Kamaro’ nanomho ko na ociya?
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: Ahowiday.
Pinanomho.
Wa: nga’ay nanomen kona ociya namo.
Kaenenta kona kidafes.
Wa: nengenhan nga’ayay kaenen kona kotamono.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: Nga’ayay kaenen kona kidafes haw?
Hayi, solinay nga’ayay a kaenen.
Maharekay to ciwina Mitangtang to saka lafi, katayni malafi.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: Hay, minanawho kako to kamay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: Harikaenen, cowa ko tao kiso.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: Adihayayto ko mikaenan ako, mafecolay kako.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: Adihayen ko mikaenan, akaka ngodo.
Hayi, nga’ayay kaenen.
Miliyasto kako, liyaw sato kako a tayni miliso’ tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: Hayda, liyaw’araw.
To’emanayto, minokayto kako.
Miliyawho atayni misalama haw?
Cedengen ko rakakat.
Hayda, ano ira koromi’ad tayni sato misalama.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho a mapolong, anini a romi’ad tayraen no Singsi kita i niyaro’ ami homong to malitengay.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: Hayo,misano ’amis kita a caciyaw to malitengay.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說阿美語。

S.FORM: Mangataayto kita a tahira haw?
Mangataay to kita a tahira.
Akong, tayniay kami a miliso’ itisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: Ha: mafana’ay kamo to sowal no ’amis, tada nga’ay.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說阿美語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: Nga’ayho a mapolong, anini aromi’ad tayraen no singsi Kita i lamelomeloan a omah a maomah.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: Hayi, singsi.
Masarayaray a ma^min, aka tawalen ko saka tayal.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: Hay, singsi, maalaay to niyam ko sakatayal.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: maraoday to ita haw? .
Caho, maraayay ho.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: Olili raso’enho to nanom.
Hay, raso’en ako.
Alaen ko sapilaplap to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: Hay, milaplap kako to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho a maemin, anini a romi’ad tayra kita i pinengnengan to a’adopen.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: Hayi tadanga’ay, samaanen ita ko katayra.
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: Mikalic kita to paso.
Masarayray a maemin, mi’aca kako to paya.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: hayi.
I a’ayaw i ono ’aya ’ayam, aikor i o ’one’oneran, paytemek han ita aminengneng.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: Singsi matalaway kako to ’oner.
Mamaam aca, olili pinengneng to ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: Cecay a tatokian itinikita a masa’opo.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: Hay, ahowiday singsi.
O maan ko ma’araway iso anini a romi’ad.
Ma’araway ako ko adihayay a ’oner, ato adihayay a ’ayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: Kalikien, miliyas to kita.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: Talaenho kako, malolayay ko o’o ako.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: Tayra kita i pidangoyan haw?
Hayda, tatata.
’Alomanay ko tamdaw a midangoy itini.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: Tangongolay i tira, nga’ay itinisa kita a midangoy.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: Samanan iso a tayni.
Rakat sanay kako a tayni.
O maan a tosiyaan ko pikalican iso a tayni.
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: Mikalicay kako to paso a tayni.
Samaanen iso a tayra i kiwkay.
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: Pakalican niwama ako kako itosiya ta malahakelong kami a tayra.
Tohatiniay samaanay ko katayra niira I pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: Mikalicay cingra to cieying a tosiya.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: Samaanan ni Ama: iso a tayra mi’aca to dateng.
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: Paka otofayay cingra a mi’aca to dateng.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: Samaanen iso a tayra i fotod.
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Mikalic kako to tamina a tayra i fotod.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: Samanan ningra a tayra i fotod?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: Mikalicay cingra to hikoki a tayra i fotod.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: O maan ko pikalican ningra a tayra i takaw.
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: Mikalicay cingra to hacikayay a cinamalay a tayra i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: Mikalicay cingra to kasoling a talaposong haw?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Hayi, mikalicay cingra to kasoling a tala posong.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: O kasoling ko pikalican niira a talaposong haw.
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: Cowa, o hikoki ko mikalican niira a talapong.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: Itini i ngata iray ko pikalican to paso haw?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: Iraay, rakaten tala’ayaw ma’arawto kopi talaan to paso.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: I cowaay ko mingataay to pikalican to cieying a Paliding.
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: Away i tini ko pitalaan to cieying. deng o haya kopi Kalican iso a tayra.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: Ano o paso ko pikalican hakowa ko halafin a tayra i pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: Lima ko safaw a efen no toki tahira i pitilidan.
Ano fesiwpas ko pikalican hakowa ko halafin tahira i tayciw.
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: Cecay a tatokian tahirato i tayciw.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: Cecay a tatokian tahirato i tayciw.
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: Ma^deng cecay a tatokian.
Hakowaay ko halafin iso a mikalic to cieying a tayni i loma’ ako.
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: Tosa polo’ a fen no toki.
Mafana’ay kiso a mitingsa haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso a koliciw haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kako a mitingsa.
Mafana’ay kako a koliciw.
Iraay ko otofay iso haw?
Iraay ko cecay a otofay ako.
Iraay ko otofay iso haw?
Away ko otofay ako.
Nga’ay kako a milicay tisowanan haw?
Nga’ayto, makahi kako.
Nga’ay kako a milicay tisowanan haw?
Aka, caayka adihay ko kafana’an ako.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: Ano harek no lahok ira ko romi’ad iso haw? tayra kako mihomong i tisowanan sakako nga’ay haw?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: Hayda, iloma’ kako a mitala i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Ira ko romi’ad iso ano papacem haw? Sapi licaw kako i tisowanan tono iti:ayho a demak.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於阿美族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I would like to ask you about the legends of the Amis.

S.FORM: Talatokos kako ano papacem, caka iloma’kako.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: O tengil ako adihay ko kafana’an iso tono liteng no ’Amis a demak, saka tayraan kako milicay i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對阿美族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Amis, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: Cowa ka adihay ko kafana’an ako. nikawrira maolah Kako a pasowal to kafana’an ako.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: Milicay kako, nga’ay a hedoten ako a misasink haw? Nga’ay caloway a matidid.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: Hayda, mamaan saw, nga’ayto.
Pinaayto ko mihecaan iso anini ?
Siwaayto a polo’ ira ko falo ko mihecaay kako.
Ka^mangay ho kiso.
Icowasaw, malitengayto kako.
O nani cowaay kiso?
O nani etolan nanay kako.
O ’Amis ko fafahi iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是阿美族人嗎?

S.FORM: Cowa, o Piwma cingra.
Hakowaay ko kafana’an iso a caciyaw?
Mafana’ay kako to sowal no ’Amis ato no Piwma.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: anini a romi’ad mahemek kako a milicay i tisowanan, pasowalen haca kako to caay kang’ay a demaken ano mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: Hayda, yo kapahho kako mararid kako a tala tokos a mi’adop.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: Ahowiday, anini a romi’ad a dihay ko pakafana’ iso tadanga’ay.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: Oso’elinay kona misowalan ako. o sowal no malitengay konini.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: Hatini aca ko kalalicay ita anini a romi’ad. ahowiday to pakafana’ iso.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: Aka ngodo, liyaw sato kita a malicay.
Miliyas to kako, nanay ano miliyaw adihay ko matengilay a tawciker no liteng.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: Hayi, cedengen ko rakat.
Nga’ayho, o maan ko a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to cecay a kokpo.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: Nga’ayho? O maan ko a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to cecay a kafong.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to kokpo, miliwalay kiso haw?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: Iraay, pina ko a’acaen iso.
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Miliwalay kiso to ’icep haw?
Away, cowa kapiliwal kako to ’icep.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to felac.
Pina a lofoc ko ’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Pafelien kako to tolo a lofoc.
Mi’aca kako to konga.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Maeminayto a maliwal ko konga.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to simal tosa a talid.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: Cecayto a talid ko ’osaw.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: Olili patadoen kako a mi’aca to fita’ol.
Pina a tingting ko ’acaen iso.
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Pina a tingting ko ’acaen iso a fita’ol.
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: Tosa a tingting ko ’acaen ako.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: Mi’aca kako to tosa a falod no kenaw.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: Toloayto kona ’osaw, emin han ako a pafeli kiso.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: Hakowaay ko ’aca nona cecay lofoc no felac?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: Tosa a so’ot no payso ko cecay lofoc.
O emin i tosapolo’ ira ko cecay a rimood. tosaen aca a polo’ a rimood.
Ahowiday.
Onini siwa a polo’, ira ko lima a rimood.
Tongalen to miming. Sacecay han a so’ot a rimood.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: O emin lima a so’ot ira ko motep a rimood.
Limaen aca a so’ot a rimood haw?
’atekakay tato, nga’ay saka emeden to miming haw?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: Cowa ka nga’ay, o saka emedayto koni.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: Maolah kako tona ’odax.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: O na odax toloapolo’ a rimood. iraho ko roma a kangalayan iso?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: Nga’ay kako a micaliw to payso iso haw?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Nga’ayto, hakowa ko caliwen iso?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: Matawalay ako a miala ko payso ako, nga’ay micaliw Kako to payso i tisowanan haw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Cowa ka piala kako to payso!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: Matawala ako a mihawikid ko payso. nga’ay kako a micaliw i tisowanan haw?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: Ayyah, yamicaliwan iso i ’ayaw caho kapatikolen iso i takowanan.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: Nga’ay kako micaliw to riko’ iso haw?
Nga’ayto, kiso to ko mialaay.
Nga’ay kako micaliw to tilid iso haw?
Mapacaliwayto ako ci Ciyaw.
Pacaliwen kako to tingsa iso haw!
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: Hayda, nikawrira patikolen ano papacem.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: Ma’oradayto, cowa ka piala kako to linay, pacaliwen Kako haw?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: Cecay ko linay ako, cacayat han ita!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: O micaliwan ako i ’ayaw kona tilid, patikolen ako.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: Ano sapi nengnengan haca kiso to tilid sowalen kako.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa kako a patikol to payci i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: Mamaan saw? ano irasato ko payci iso itiya hanto.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It's okay, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa patikol kiso to payso i takowanan?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: Ano papacem kako a patikol.
S.TRANSL: I'll return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: Ano hacowa patikol kiso to tilid i takowanan?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: Patikolan to ako i nacila kiya saw?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: Ona impic omipacaliwan ni Kacaw i tisowanan haw?
S.TRANSL: Did Kacaw lend you this pen?

S.FORM: Hay, omicaliwan ako anini i cingraan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: Ona impci i omi caliwan iso ci Kacawan haw?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Cowa, o mi’acaan ni ina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: Awaayto ko cinah, katayra ci panayan amicaliw to cinah.
S.TRANSL: We're out of salt, go borrow some from Panay.

S.FORM: Hayda, tayra kako a micaliw.
Papi patikolen ci Panay to payso i takowanan.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Panay to pay me back.

S.FORM: Hakowaay ko kiyam niira saw?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: Talacowa kiso?
Tayra kako i sadatengan a paloma to dateng.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: Mimaanay kiso?
Adihayay ko talod. Mifaresiway kako to talod. raso’en ako ano sawni.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: Padangen kako a miala to kawkaw ato pitaw haw?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: Icowaan iso a miteli.
Itatihi no kangkang.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: Mifelihanto iso kora sera haw?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: Maharekayto ako a mifelih. Mifolesak kako ano honi to sapaloma.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: Yami palomaan iso a dateng mifangadan to iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: Ona tamana nga’ayayto a litoden. ora hokoki A talod caho kanga’ay a ritriten.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: Wa: adihay ko mikowisan iso a konga.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
(sighs) Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: Patadoen kako a miteli i kofaw.
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: Mimaanay kamo.
Misalilay kami to foting.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: Adihayay ko foting i tini haw?
Adihayayto ko foting. ira i patelian.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: Samaanan iso ko pifoting to hatiniay?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: O pacing ko sapifoting ako.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso to o pana’ ko sapifoting haw?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: Tohatiniay o talakal ko sapi’adop ako. no latek nga’ o Kowang ko sapi’adot ako.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: O mirakatan no fafoy no lotok konini a lalan.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: Mana mafana’ kiso?
O nasaripa’an no fafoy konini, saka o lalan no fafoy Konini.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: Nengnengen kora talakal ako. mato ci tama’ay to.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: Mana mafana’ kiso?
Mato masanekayto no waco ko sanek. kalikien tayra kita.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: O maan kora misanga’an iso no hatini?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: O mi’enecan to fakelohan a talakal konini. o sapi tala Kal to ’edo.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: O maan kora mitelian iso i tira?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: O miso’otay to ’o’o a talakal kora, o sapi talakal to to mancel.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: Ahowiday ko palemed no liteng, anini a romi’ad a dihay ko tama’ ita.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: So’linay, patayraen ita i niyaro’pakowat to finawlan.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Pasifana’en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano’Amis ko 動物.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的阿美語怎麼說。
will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Pasifana’en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano’Amis ko 植物.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的阿美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of plants in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Pasifana’en no singsi kita anini to samaan han a misano’Amis ko 水果
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的阿美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Pangcah language today.

S.FORM: Aka kafoti’.
Aka kacaciyaw.
Aka kakomaen.
Alaen a pasadak ko tanengnengan no miso.
Alaen a pasadak ko impic no miso.
Alaen a pasadak ko tatiliden no miso.
Solimeten to ko tanengnengan.
Solimeten to ko impic.
Solimeten to ko kakaenen.
Solimeten to ko tasalamaan.
O no nima a impic koni?
O no mako.
O no nima a tanengnengan koni?
O ni Kacaw.
O no nima a sasipasip koni?
Cowa kafana’ kako.
O riko’ ni Kacaw kora han?
Cowa, o riko’ ni Panay koni.
Singsi, cowa kapihawikid kako to tanengnengan.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: Hacafay han ko kapot a minengneng.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: Maketonay to ko impic no mako.
Tanoimpicen a mitilid.
Mahidayay to ko sasipasip no mako.
Pacaliwen kiso to sasipasip no mako.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: Pahanhan to kita, na’onen to ko rakat a minokay!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: Hai, aray singsi.
Pahanhan to kita, sanga’ayen to ko no mita.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: Sanga’ayen to ko no miso singsi.
Nga’ay ho ci Apetayan ko ngangan no mako.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Apetayan.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ho Apetayan.
Nga’ay ho ci Kacaw ko ngangan no mako.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Kacaw.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ho Kacaw.
Nga’ay ho ci Alang kako.
Nga’ay ho ko no miso Kacaw, ci Nikar kako.
Nga’ay ho, ci Mayaw kako.
Nga’ay ho ko no miso Mayaw, ci Amoy kako.
Cima kiso?
O ina ni Lafin kako, ci Amoy kako.
Cima kiso?
O safa ni Lafin kako, ci Anay ko ngangan no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我是Lfin的妹妹，我的名字是Anay。
I am Lfin’s sister. My name is Anay.

S.FORM: Cima cingra?
O singsi ako cingra, ci Kanas ko ngangan ningra.
O cima kora tamdaw?
O kaka ako cingra, ci Yosi ko ngangan ningra.
Ci Apetayan cingra saw?
Hai, ci Apetayan cingra.
Ci Apetayan kiso saw?
Cowa, ci Sontok kako.
Cima ci Apetayan?
Kako ko ci Apetayan.
Ci Apetayan kako.
Cima ci Sontok?
O widang ako ci Sontok.
Cima ko ngangan no kaka iso?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: Ci Akiko ko ngangan no kaka ako.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Akiko.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan no safa iso?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: Ci Panay ko ngangan no safa ako.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Panay.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso to ngangan ningra han?
Ci Apetayan ko ngangan ningra.
Pinaay to ko mihecaan no kaka iso anini?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: Limaay to ko safaw ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Pinaay to ko mihecaan no safa iso anini?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: Limaay to ko mihecaan ningra anini.
Iraay ko pitilidan namo i niyaro’ han?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: Hai, iraay.
Itiniay i pitilidan no niyaro’ ko pitilid no miso han?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: Hai, hato malacecayay a lalomaan kami a mitilid i pitilidan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school

S.FORM: Cima kora fa’inayan?
O faki ako cingra.
Cima kora fafahiyan?
O kaka ako cingra.
Cima kora wawa?
O fa’inayan a safa ako cingra.
O manan ko tayal no wina iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: O sufitay cingra.
O manan ko tayal no wama iso?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: O singsi cingra.
O safa iso to fa’inayan cingra han?
Cowa, o widang no safa ako to fa’inayan cingra.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。

S.FORM: O kaka iso to fafahiyan cingra han?
Cowa, o safa ako to fafahiyan cingra.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko paro no loma’ nangra?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: Lalimaay ko paro no loma’ nangra.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko wawa no loma’ namo?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: Sasepatay ko wawa niyam.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko safa iso to fa’inayan ato fafahiyan?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Awaay ko safa ako to fa’inayan, tatoloay ko safa ako to fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters

S.FORM: Papinaay ko kaka iso to fa’inayan ato fafahiyan?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Awaay ko kaka ako to fa’inayan ato fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: Papinaay ko salikaka iso?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Awaay ko salikaka ako.
O malikakaay kamo?
Hai, o kaka ako to fa’inayan cingra.
O Yencomin kamo han?
Hai, o Yencomin kami.
O ’Amis cingra han?
Hai, o ’Amis cingra.
Samaanay ko romi’ad anini?
Si^naway to miming, kapinanom to fa^detay a nanom.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad anini?
Fa^edetay ko romi’ad to miming, kapinanom to nanom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad i kaotal?
Ta’angayay ko cidal.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: Samaanay ko romi’ad i kaotal?
tanoto’em sanay, awaay a masadak ko cidal i kakarayan.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: masamaan ko romi’ad ano cila?
cowa kacidal, mato’em ta’angay aca ko fali ano cila.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: masamaan ko romi’ad toya romi’ad hakiya?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: si^naway to ko romi’ad anini, kaciriko’ to to kifetolay a riko’ ano mamasadak.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: masamaan ko romi’ad to pa’aliwacan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: makapah ko romi’ad to pa’aliwacan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: wa mama’orad toya romi’ad haw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: makapah ko romi’ad toya romi’ad, cowa ko mama’orad.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: wa mama’orad toya romi’ad haw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Hai, wa mama’orad toya romi’ad.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: ma’oraday no hatini haw?
masaesa’ay to ko ’orad, masadakay to ko cidal!
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: ma’oraday no hatini haw?
ma’oraday to! cowa kapihawikid kako to sa’ong.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ma’oraday i kaotal haw?
cowa ho ka’orad no hatini, wa mama’orad ano herek no lahok, kacisa’ong to ano mamasadak.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: wa si^naw ko romi’ad to kasi^nawan to roma a mihecaan hakiya?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: Hai, wa tadasi^naw ko romi’ad to kasi^nawan ano roma a mihecaan, saka pakapien to ko kaciriko’.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: fa^det ko romi’ad tona kaciherangan nona mihecaan hakiya?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: Hai, fa^det ko romi’ad to kaciherangan, saka saadihayen to ko pinanom to nanom.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: maolahay kiso to kacanglahan han?
maolahay kako to kacanglahan, samanen haw i, dihekoay ko romi’ad to kacanglahan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: maolahay kiso to laloodan han?
cowa kaolah kako to laloodan, samanen haw i, adihayay ko faliyos to laloodan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: matawalay ako a miala ko codad.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: matawalay ako a miala ko tanengnengan.
malacafay kako i tisowanan a minengneng.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: matawalay ako a miala ko sararop.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: matawalay ako a miala ko sasipasip.
pacaliwen ako kiso.
matawalay iso a miala ko impic han?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: Hai, pacaliwen ho kako to impic iso manga’ay to haw?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: o manan ko kakaenen no miso a sakalahok?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?\\n8.

S.FORM: o ^pang ko kakaenen no mako.
o manan ko kakaenen no miso a sakalafi?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: komaen kako to holo.
komaen kako to hemay.
o holo ko kakaenen no mako.
o hemay ko kakaenen no mako.
o manan ko mikaenan no miso a sakaranam?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: o fita’ol ko mikaenan no mako.
o manan ko mikaenan no miso a sakalahok?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: o titi no koko’ ko mikaenan no mako.
misalama kami to mali.
’ayaw to kiso a tayra, kilim han to ako kiso ano honi.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: midangoy kami.
Hayda, malacafay kita a tayra.
mimali kami.
Naay, micolo’ ho kami to codad.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: mi’ora’oray to kiso?
miri’iway to kiso?
caho, mifanaway ho kako to kaysing.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: mi’ora’oray to kiso?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: mi’ora’oray to kako.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: mifanawan to iso ko kaysing han?
mafanaway to ako ko kaysing no mako.
mana ca kapinanaw kiso to kamay?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: mananaw to kako ano honi.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: nimaanay kiso ihoni?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: mikilimay kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: wa mimaan kiso ano minoky nani pitilidan?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: tangsol sa kako a minokay.
wa mimaan cingra ano minokay nani pitilidan?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: wa mamakero cingra.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Asenay, i loma’ay kiso haw?
Hai, kapicomod.
Asenay, i loma’ay kiso haw?
ci Omos kako, awaay i loma’ ci Asenay, wa mimaan saw? ano minokay to ci Asenay i, pasowal han to ako cingra.
S.TRANSL: Asenay不在家耶!我是Omos，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Asenay。
Asenay is not at home. I am Omos. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: cima kamo?
mamo, ci Afas aci Asenay kami, patadoen ho kami a mifawah!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Afas和Asenay，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Afas and Asenay, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: cima saw?
ci Fuya kako, o mamikilim kako ci Ofayan.
S.TRANSL: I am Fuya, I am here for Ofay.

S.FORM: mamo, tayniay kako a miliso’ i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: halafinay to kiso a ca katayni, ma’ilolay to kako i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Asenay, kilimen to ako kiso a misalama.
S.TRANSL: Asenay, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: kapicomod to, halafinay to ko pitatala ako i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: o nipasinikan no mako koni a konga, tanamen a komaen makena!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: ko^sanay koni a konga.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: katayni! o nipalomaan no mako a losay koni, tanamen a komaen.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: tadako^sanay to koni a losay.
kamaro’! tanamen a komaen koni nipalomaan ako a ariray!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: waw! tadako^sanay to koni a ariray.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: komaen kiso to mami’ han?
cowa kanga’ay kako a komaen to mami’, o lingko to ko kaenen no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: komaen kiso to ’asiro han?
cowa kanga’ay kako a komaen to ’asiro, o lingko to ko kaenen no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: komaen kiso to ^pang haw?
Hai, maolahay kako.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: kelacen ako ko losay a pakaen i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: Aray, makasalangay to koni a losay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: alaen ako ko nanom a pananom i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: Aray.
halikaenen, adihayay ko mitangtangan ako a dateng.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: waw! tada fangsisay a kaenen.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: halikaenen, adihayay ho ko kakaenen itini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: ano hatira i, cowa to kangodo kako a komaen yo!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: halikaenen, adihayay ho ko kakaenen itini.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself.There is a lot more.

S.FORM: adihayay to ko mikaenan no mako, cowa to kanga’ay a komaen.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: keriden no singsi kamo a talatokos anini.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: adihayay ko likes i tokos sanay ci ina.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: keriden no singsi kamo a talaomah anini.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: tayra kita a mipitaw han?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: o tatalacowa kita anini?
keriden no singsi kita a tayra i ’alo.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: o tatalacowa kita anini?
keriden no singsi kita a talatokos.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: o tatala’alo kita anini han?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: cowa, o kakeriden no singsi kita a talatokos.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: o tatalatokos kita anini han?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: cowa, o tatalaomah kita anini.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: singsi, o manan ko nanengnengen no mita a tala’alo?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: minengneng kita to facacido’.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, o manan ko nanengnengen no mita a talatokos?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: minengneng kita to ’adipangpang.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: o mamimaan kita a talaomah?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: talaomah kita a minengneng to nipalomaan ita a ariray, iraay ko kakonah ’odal kapina’on to yo!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: singsi, o tatala’alo kita a midangoy han?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: cowa, o maminengneng kita to facacido’.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: singsi, o tatalaomah kita a mipaloma to dateng han?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: o mamipitaw kita anini.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: iraay ko sa ’efe’efer sanay a facacido’ itira.
anini kako a paka’araw to so^linay ma’oripay ho a facacido’.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: iraay ko sa ’efe’efer sanay a ’adipangpang itira.
watah! maolahay kako to ’adipangpang, makapahay.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: iraay ko sa ’efe’efer sanay a ’adipangpang itira.
cowa ko ’adipangpang kora, o ’odal kora.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: itini to a misanengnengnengneng, aka to katalaraay yo!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: Hai, cowa katalaraay kami.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: aka to kacomikay, sanga’ayen ko rakat ’arawi a mapoling.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: nanay narikay a ma’araw no mako.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: pakamaanay kiso a talatalo’an?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: pakapalidingay kako a talatalo’an.
pakamaanay cingra a tayra i paisingan?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: rakat sanay cingra a tayra i paisingan.
pakamaanay kiso a tayra i Penghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: pakahikokiay kako a tayra i Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: pakamaanay kiso a tayra i Penghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: pakataminaay kako a tayra i Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: pakamaanay kiso a minokay?
paka捷運nay kako a minokay.

S.FORM: pakacinamalay ci Panay a talapitilidan.
S.TRANSL: Panay goes to school by train.

S.FORM: pakamaanay ci Kacaw a talakiwkay?
S.TRANSL: How does Kacaw go to church?

S.FORM: pakakoliciway ci Kacaw a talakiwkay.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: paka捷運nay kiso a talapitilidan han?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: cowa, pakapasuay kako a talapitilidan.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: pakakoliciway kiso a talapitilidan han?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: Hai, pakakoliciway kako a talapitilidan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: paka高鐵ay kiso a talaTakaw han?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: Hai, paka高鐵ay kako a talaTakaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: pakacinamalay anca pakahikokiay kiso a talaPosong han?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: pakahikokiay, pakahikokiay ko kalikiay to pakacinamalay.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: pakapasuay anca pakapalidingay kiso a talakiwkay han?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: pakapalidingay kako a talakiwkay, pakapalidingay ko calowayay to pakapasuay.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: mangataay no patiyamay ko loma’ namo han?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: cowa kangata, pakaotopayay to kako a tayra i patiyamay.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: mangataay no pitilidan ko yofing han?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: mangataay, rakat han tahira to.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: mangataay no siyataw ko kakomaenan han?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: masadak nani siyataw maedeng lima a fun ko rarakaten tahira to.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: cilimaw kiso anini haw?
mamaanay?
sapiliso’aw kako i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: iraay ko demak no mako awaay i loma’ kako anini, liyaw sa to a romi’ad makena?
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家，改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: cilimaw kiso ano cila haw? herek no lahok tayra kako a mikilim i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: nga’ay to, tala han ako kiso i loma’.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: manga’ay kako a misolot to ngiha iso han? sapikilokan nanay kako.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: hayda! nga’ayay to. awa ko maan.
manga’ay a sasingen haw?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: cowa kakapah kako, cowa ho kalosimet koni a ’ariri, aka to.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: ano hatira i, sasing han aca ako.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: aka to kapisasing.
aray han ako kiso to pihai iso to pihomong ako i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: awaay ko maan, o manan ko lalicayen no miso?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: o manan ko midemakan no miso i kakaemangan ho?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: o malatayxinay kako i ’ayaw, misawaday to kako no hatini.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: matayalay ho kiso no hatini?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: matayalay kako i pitilidan.
itiniay i niyaro’ ko aro’ no wawa iso han?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: cowa, itiniay i tokay ko aro’ no wawa ako.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: cecayay kiso a maro’ haw?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: iraay ho ko cecay a waco ato cecay a ’ayam, o paro no loma’ ako cangra.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: iraay aca ko cecay a posi, ira ko pipacafay no pinanowang i, caay to kato’ol.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: milicay kako i tisowanan to pakiniay to paysin no pi’adop hananay.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: cowa kaadihay ko kafana’an ako, ora kafana’an no mako i, haemin han ako a pakafana’ i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: ora sapi’adop namo a sakatayal i, iraay ko maan a paysinan han?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: tati’ihay a papitefingen ko fafahiyan to sapi’adop niyam a sakatayal.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: manga’ay a mitoor ko fafahiyan a mi’adop han?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: cowa, tati’ihay a mi’adop ko fafahiyan.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Kacaw, awaay to ko epah no loma’ ’acaen ho ko epah ito.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Kacaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: iraay ho ko cecay i kofaw, ca to kapi’aca haw!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: cowa kaedeng ko cecay, ’acaen ho ko tosa a minokay.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: mi’aca kako to epah, paliwalay kamo han?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: iraay! pina ko ’a’acaen no miso?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: tosa ko ’a’acaen ako, mi’aca ho kako to cecay lofoc a felac.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: ini ko felac, o manan ho ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: mi’aca ho kako to fita’ol, iraay han?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: maeminay to a mapaliwal ko fita’ol.
mi’aca kako to riko’.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: o samaanay ko ’a’acaen iso?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: o kamoko’ay ko taca^dongan a riko’ ko ’a’acaen ako.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: masamaan koni kahengangay a riko’?
iraay ho ko roma a cengel han?
iraay ho ko kohecalay ato langdaway niyam.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: pafelien kako to cecay langdaway a riko’.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Kacaw, o talacowaay kiso i honi? miontoay kiso han?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Kacaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: cowa, mipadangay kako ci mamoan a mipaliwal to dateng.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ha, hatiniay han, cilimaw kiso ano dadaya? malacafay i takowanan a malafi makena?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: cowa kanga’ay, mi’aca kako to riko’.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: ano hatira i, tooren ako kiso a tayra.
nga’ay ho, pina ko ’aca nona dateng?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: tosa a polo’ ko ’aca no dateng to cecay a lolong.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pina ko ’aca nona konga?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: tolo a polo’ ko ’aca no konga to cecay a tingting.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: pafelien kako to tosa lolong a dateng ato cecay tingting a konga.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Kacaw, matawalay ako a miala ko impic, manga’ay a pacaliwen iso kako han?
S.TRANSL: Kacaw，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Kacaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: awaay ko no mako, o ni Panay koni.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

S.FORM: manga’ay a pacaliwen kako to miming han? kalikien to ako a patikol i tisowanan.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: hayda, na.
aray, patadoen to kako a miaray ci Panayan.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: o manan ko aalaen iso?
mipatikol kako tona tosa a codad.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: hay, iraay ho ko roma to aalaen iso?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: micaliw ho kako tona tolo a codad.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: maherek to, haratengen ikor no tolo a romi’ad patikolen to a tayni.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: cowa ho kapatikolen iso kako to sararop.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: patikolan to ako i nacila.
mana awa to ko sararop no mako.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: mipacaliwan iso ci Kacaw cowa saw?
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Kacaw?

S.FORM: cowa kafana’ kako, licayen ako cingra.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: pacaliwen ho ako kiso to no mako a sararop.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Panay, o mipacaliwan ni Kacaw kisonan koni a ciyampa han?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did Kacaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: cowa, o mi’acaan ni ina ako to hano mako.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mahecaday ko ciyampa ni Kacaw to no miso.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: o kohetingay ko no mira a ciyampa, cowa kahecad ko cengel niyam.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Panay, micaliway kiso to payci i ci Kacawan han?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did you borrow money from Kacaw?

S.FORM: Hai , o papatikolen no mako i cingranan anini nika , matawalay ako a miala ko payci.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: ano hacowa to a patikolen iso saw?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: patikolen to ako i cingranan ano cila.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: Hayda, pasowal han to ako ci Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Kacaw for you.

S.FORM: Tanofakelohen a micepet ko edo, tanokaereden a micepet ko tikolacay nga’ matatodongay.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤石頭抓，⽵雞應該要⽤繩子抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Masahatiniay han, mararaway to kako! salaw cowa kapakacepecepet kako.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Ano hatira haw i, pasifana’en ako kiso to samaanen a misanga’ kona tosa a talakal.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: Hayda! tadafangcal! ano hatini haw i, ikor to wapakacepet to kako to ’a’adopen.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Sa akawang sanay to ko talod no omah, katayra ho kiso i soko a miala to kawkaw, talaomah kita.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: i cowaay a mateli ko kawkaw?
i tatihiay no fakar, ano micomod kiso i soko i, ma’araw to.
S.TRANSL: 在籐籃的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Kapina’on to a miala, ’arawi a madoka’. citalemay ko kawkaw.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Aka ripa’en ko talakal no mako.
I cowaay ko talakal no miso?
itiraay i laeno nora kilang ko talakal no mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: mana pakaharateng ho kiso?
iraay ko kacipinangan no mako itini, mafana’ay kako to i cowaay ko talakal ako.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: o fofo koni, telian niyam i ’alo a mifoting.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: awaay ko fofo no niyam itira, tanopacemotan no niyam ko pifoting.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: cowa ho kapipacemot kako tono pacemot, manga’ay a pasifana’en kako ano cila haw?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你明天教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: hayda! malacafay kita a mipacemot ano cila.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們明天一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: pasifana’en ako kiso a misanga’ to fofo ano cila.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: tatemikay to ko pacemot no miso, komaenay to ko foting to sapariri’ iso alatek! kalikien a mitengteng a patalafekang.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: aka ho, macoyacoyay tato ko tamina. itini kako a mitengteng to pacemot, itira kiso a mipadang i takowanan a miala to salil a patayni.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，魚船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: pataynien i takowanan a mitengteng ko foting, patadoen no mako kiso a patalafekang.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: tadafangcalay to makadofah ko kinaira ita anini, matomes ko paro no kanas.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: kalikien no mita a minokay a mipalada’ to alomanay.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: Tayniay to ko singsi.
Aka to pisalama, Kalikien a maro’ i ’adengang.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: kangodoan to, maapacay to kako!
kalikien a micomod.
Sakapina no lipay anini?
Sakalima a lipay anini, pahanhan anocila, malacafay kita a misalama!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，我們一起去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: Hayda! tayla kita i ’aro.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: Sakapina no lipay anocila?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: Sakatolo a lipay anocila, misalama kita to nanom i helek no lahok anocila!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩水吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: Mamimaan kiso anopapacem?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: Paaliwacan anocila, malacafay kako ci inaan a tayra i kiwkay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: Mamaanay to kiso?
Sakaota’aw sanay kako, tayra ho kako i kamisi’an.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Maliyonay ko tangal ako.
Hinefa han ho iso a pahanhan.
Singsi, adada ko tiyad ako, tayla ho kako i kamisi’an.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，我先去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: Hayda, kalikien a tayra.
Manga’ay kako a minanaw to kamay haw?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: O mamipahanhan to, honisato a tayra.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Singsi, adada ko tangal ako, mihifang to helek no lahok.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: Hayda, na’onen to a minokay.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: Singsi, mihifang kako anocila to sakacecay a lipay, paising ho kako.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: Hayda, nonengen to ko tireng.
Icowaay ci Panay?
Adada ko tiyad ningra, ira cingra i kamisi’an.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Kacaw?
Singsi, adada ko takolaw ni Kacaw, mihifangay anini.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kacaw has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: Mana awa ci Panay a tayni saw?
Malalisanay cingra.
Pasifana’en ho kami tisowanan!
Ci Canglah Kaynga kako, mo^etepay ko mihecaan ako.
S.TRANSL: My name is Canglah Kaynga, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: Cima ko ngangan iso?
Ci Canglah Kaynga kako.
O maan a kasafinacadan a wawa kiso?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: O wawa no ’Amis kako.
Saheto o Yincomin ko paro no loma’ iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Hai, saheto o ’Amis ko paro no loma’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是阿美族人。
Yes, my whole family is Amis.

S.FORM: Saheto o Yincomin ko paro no loma’ iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: Caayay, o ’Amis ko wama ako, o Payrang ko wina ako.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是阿美族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Amis, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: Nima a wawa kiso?
Ni Mayaw Lohok a wawa kako.
Ci wama iso kora haw? pina to ko mihecaan ningra?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Enem polo’ to ko mihecaan ningra.
Ci wama iso kora haw? pina to ko mihecaan ningra?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: Caayay, o mato’say niyam cingra i niyaro’, falo polo’ to ko mihecaan ningra.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: Pina to ko mihecaan no fa’inayan a kaka iso?
Safaw falo to ko mihecaan no fa’inayan a kaka ako.
Hakowaay ko karaaraay no mihecaan namo?
S.TRANSL: Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: Lima a mihecaan ko karaaraay niyam.
Hakowaay ko ’akawang iso?
Cecay so’ot sepat polo’ a kongfen ko ’akawang ako.
Halafin to caka saso’araw kita, ’akawangay to kiso?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: Hai, cecay so’ot tolo polo’ a kongfen ko ’akawang ako.
Masoesoay to kiso haw?
Caayay, mararaw ko pinengneng iso.
Mangiriway to kiso haw?
Caayay, masoesoay to kako.
Masoesoay to kiso haw?
Hai, tolo polo’ to ko tingting ako hatini.
Talacowa kiso?
Tayra kako i katayalan a mikilim to singsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: Tatalacowa ci Kacaw?
Mifalah to lakaw cingra.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Kacaw?
Ira i pidangoyan cingra, malalifet to pidangoy cingra anohoni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci Panay? malalifet to comikayay cingra anohoni.
S.TRANSL: Panay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Panay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: Ira i riwang cingra, tahidangen ako cingra.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: Mahakelong kita tayra i piongtoan.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: Miaca ho kako to sakalahok, kilim han to ako kiso anohoni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: Mahakelong kita a mililid to tafoan!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: Kilimen iso ko tao, mikilim kako to singsi.
S.TRANSL: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Malalifetay ci Kacaw to milalayapay a cikay anini haw?
S.TRANSL: Is Kacaw competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: Caayay, malalifet to misaterocay cingra.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: Mamilalifet kiso i piondokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Hai, malalifet kako to comikayay.
Mamilalifet kiso i piondokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: Hai, malalifet kako to milalayapay a cikay.
O mamimaan kita i piondokayan saw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: Malalifet kita to matatengtengay.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: Paliwal kita to kakaenen i piondokayan haw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: Caayay, o kikoya ko paliwalen no mita.
Pakaala kiso to icifang, ci’icelay to kiso!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，你真厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: Aray.
Ira ci mamo i loma’ haw?
Iraay, mafoti’ay cingra i kafoti’an.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: Ira ci mamo i loma’ haw?
Awaay, masadakay to cingra ihoni, dadaya to nga minokayay.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: Ira ci akong i loma’ haw?
Ira cingra i sakatosa a tingroh, kilimen iso cingra i kafekang.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: Ira ko tamdaw i loma’ haw?
Ci Kacaw! halafin to caka araw kiso, nga’ayay kiso haw? ?
S.TRANSL: 是Kacaw!很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?(※Kacaw改為各族男生名)
It’s Kacaw. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: Fangcal to! kilimen ako kiso a malaholol.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: Icowaay ci mama^ iso?
Ira cingra i kofaw a misafel, atien ako cingra.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房煮菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: Talacowaay ci Panay saw?
S.TRANSL: Panay去哪裡了?(※Panay改為各族女生名)

S.FORM: Tayra cingra i pakoko’an a micapet to koko’.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: Akong, tayniay to kami.
Awaay ci akong namo i loma’, i omahay cingra, i loma’ a mitala kamo cingraan.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: Faki tayni to kiso!
Halafin to caka saso’araw kita, ’akawangay to kiso.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: Mahemek a ma’araw kiso a tayni.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: O hano namo koni a talacay, telien i pingsiyang.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: Halafin caka tayni, atien ako cangra a malacafay kita a mitaheka.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫他們一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: Aka to malifotaw , o ociya ko nanomen ako nga’ay to, i palafangan kita a malaholol.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: Aray to pisitay no miso, minokay to kako.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: I sawniay ho a pacoken koni a koko’, panokayen o hakakaenen no miso.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去吃吧。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: I dafak helek no lahok ko pitelek kisonan nga’ay to haw?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: Nga’ay to, icowa kita a masaso’araw?
I pitilidan kita nga’ay to haw? misasing kita.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: Itira i sefi ko nga’ay, ciriko’ kako to no Pangcah.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: Tada makapahay ko celek no sakola i niyaro’ ita. ka fitelekan no hana i, tayni sato a misalama!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候再來這裡玩!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: Tahira i kacanglahan, halafinay tato!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太久了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: I ka ilisinan a tayni kiso da!
S.TRANSL: 那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: Hayda! hinatalaay kako!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: Mana mafolaw kiso a tayni i niyaro’?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: Malasingsi kako a minokay.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: Naw caka i tokay a pasifana’?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: Nawhani ma’ilol kako to niyaro’, nanay ira ko pipanocay i niyaro’.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: Mafana’ay kiso a mitenoon, cima ko pasifana’ay tisowanan?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: Ci mamo ako, o tada mafana’ay cingra a mitenoon a tamdaw i niyaro’ niyam.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: Mana sapi nanamaw kiso a mitenoon?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: O serangawan no mita ko tenoon, sapi parayrayaw kako to serangawan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: Fangcal a ’owaken koni a epah.
Kako ko mieraway yo!
Tada caloway to kiso, halafin ko pieraw haw?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: Caay, cecay a lipay manga’ay to. rahkaden ho ko falinono ato felac, tongalen to otong a mitiyol, ta manga’ay to a telien i koreng.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: O maan ko paliwalan no miso?
Ira ko damdam ato lakiw itini takowanan, saheto no mako a mipalomaan yo!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: Tosa ko ’acaen, pina ko ’aca nira?
Tosa so’ot lima polo’ ko polong a pida.
Maolah kako toni a riko’, pina ko ’aca nira?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: Lima so’ot a pida konian.
’Atekesay, nga’ay saka^emeden to miming haw?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: Tati’ihay, ano saka^meden masipon kako.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: Hayda! cecay a kohetingay ko alaen ako a riko’.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我拿一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: Alaen ako koni a po’ot ato dangah.
S.TRANSL: 我拿這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: Tosa patek ko polong a pida, tano kamayan ako a misanga’ toni, tada fangcal a cokaymasen.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，非常好用。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: Siwkayen ako ko widang tayni a mi’aca, manga’ay a saka^meden haw?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: hayda! keroren ako to falo a ’aca.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: Ati tayni a minengneng! ira ko riko’ ato kafong ko mipa’acaan.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: Pinaay ko ’aca noni a riko’?
Tolo so’ot lima polo’ ko ’aca no cecay a riko’, cecay patek ko tolo a riko’.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: Cecay aca ko ’acaen ako, pafelien kako to faelohay.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: Nga’ay ho, sapi ’acaaw kako to hakhak ato mi’imocan a titi.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: Maeminay to ko hemay. ira ho ko tana a yoping ako, ’acaen iso haw?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: Hayda! pafelien kako to cecay, miliyaw to a tayni, ta mi’aca kako to hemay.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: Hai, paroen ako i lofoc, lima polo’ a pida konian.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我用袋子裝起來，這個50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
